topics.title: DDoS resistance
topics.body: How good is a Zeronet site at resisting a DDoS attack? If a site was really popular and had loads of peers would it be able to hold up to an attack? Also is it even possible to DDoS a Zeronet site? I have never heard of a torrent being DDoSed before.

topics.title: Biggest site list so far
topics.body:
I collected all the zeronet sites I could find and put them into one categorized list.

You can see it here: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1wiNterrFAMqQ2Vmdnc5SDHWgPNy8RTBP/listofsites.html

1@6.body: Saw it on /r/bitcoin a little while ago

2@2.body:
Attempted to set up a blog. If anyone could test it that would be awesome. 

http://127.0.0.1:43110/17WUZGKQ1AhZLT8vENfWKb3ZvsrCAscsKg

> [nofish](#comment_63_2): Winter_Fox: Attempted to set up a blog. If anyone could test it that would be awesome.http://127.0.0.1:43110/17WUZGKQ1AhZLT8vENfWKb3ZvsrCAscsKg
> 
> Works for me!

Awesome. Zeronet is really cool. Much better then I expected.

> [nofish](#comment_64_2): Winter_Fox: Awesome. Zeronet is really cool. Much better then I expected.
> 
> You can post images by copy it to your site directory (data/17WUZGKQ1AhZLT8vENfWKb3ZvsrCAscsKg) then insert using ![image alt](anyimg.png)
> I'm planning to add image upload to editing interface, but haven't got there yet.

Ah, I thought it might be something like that

2@78.body: Can zeronet sites read this file or only get the pub key?

4@2.body: How do the messages get added to the site without being signed by the owners key?

3@20.body:
> [unknown](#comment_1_90): nofish when I clicked on your link, I got "Media referer error"Exactly how it was spelled too.

I think he meant to link http://127.0.0.1:43110/1BLuish1ZbwVfPaCSDVQkg5WW58hqEoYQw/index.html
